title: fix: remove unstable flux-2-dev, add qwen-character, update airforce pricing
author: voodoohop

gist.headline: Qwen enters the hive
gist.blurb: Ready for some roleplay? We've added the `qwen-character` model and slashed prices on Airforce models by half!
gist.summary: Introduced the `qwen-character` text model optimized for roleplay, reduced Airforce model pricing by 50%, and removed the unstable `flux-2-dev` model to improve reliability.
gist.impact: Users gain access to specialized roleplay capabilities and cheaper generation rates, with improved platform stability.
gist.visual_concept: The PR introduces a 'character' roleplay model. The visual metaphor should be the bee mascot engaging in a tabletop RPG or acting scene (wearing a costume) to represent 'roleplay'. The setting should be cozy and game-like.
gist.image_prompt: Cozy pixel art scene of the chubby 8-bit bee mascot wearing a tiny wizard hat, rolling a pixelated 20-sided die next to a glowing character sheet. Soft lime green (#ecf874) and pastel peach gradient background. Chunky retro sprites, warm lighting, lo-fi tabletop RPG vibes. Nostalgic but beautiful, emotionally warm.

image.prompt: Cozy pixel art scene of the pollinations.ai bee chatting with a pixelated fantasy adventurer character in a warm tavern. Soft lime green (#ecf874) and peach gradient background. Chunky retro sprites, dialogue bubbles with pixel text. Warm lighting, lo-fi vibes like Stardew Valley. Nostalgic but beautiful, emotionally warm.
